title: How to Find Out Whether a Girl Loves You or Is Just Being a Good Friend

steps.title: Look for eye contact.
steps.content: Look for eye contact. If a girl looks down when she first sees you, or if she lowers her head while smiling, it’s a strong indicator that she’s attracted to you. It can be hard to look someone in the eye when you have strong feelings that are not yet exposed. [1] X Research source Triangulation describes a pattern of eye movement that is a strong indicator that a girl is into you. She will look at one eye, then the other, then your mouth, and then repeat the sequence. [2] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Watch for hair twirling.
steps.content: Watch for hair twirling. Playing with hair causes blood to flow and makes you feel connected with your body, so if you notice a girl twirling hair, it’s a positive sign. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Pay attention to body language.
steps.content: Pay attention to body language. If a girl leans in close to you, makes an excuse to touch you, or lets each touch linger for a longer period of time, then she may see you as more than a friend. If she touches your shoulder, brushes your hand, or hugs you for no real reason, it is a positive indication she likes you . If a girl wants to share a drink or food with you, chances are she is way into you.

steps.title: Notice if she laughs at your jokes, even when they are not funny.
steps.content: Notice if she laughs at your jokes, even when they are not funny. If a girl has a large smile every time you two have a conversation, and laughs nonstop, then she thoroughly enjoys your company. This is an unconscious way of saying, “I really like you, and I love listening to you talk". [4] X Research source When in love , you see that person through rose-colored glasses, making everything that person says seem perfect and funny.

steps.title: Pay attention to how she treats you in comparison with other guy friends.
steps.content: Pay attention to how she treats you in comparison with other guy friends. If she likes you, she'll probably act shyer or blush a lot when you are around. If she treats you the same as other guy friends, chances are she just wants to be friends.

steps.title: Observe her behavior when you are in a group.
steps.content: Observe her behavior when you are in a group. If a girl likes you, she may give you tons of attention, even if she is around other people. This is because you are the one she prefers talking to and spending time with. [5] X Research source

steps.title: See how well she knows your interests.
steps.content: See how well she knows your interests. If a girl has romantic feelings for you, she will remember specific details about what you say. For example, she will remember when you said you prefer chicken to steak, or keep track of all your favorite songs. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Do a jealousy test.
steps.content: Do a jealousy test. See if she gets angry and jealous when you flirt with another girl. If she seems bothered or starts asking you what you were talking about with that other girl, then she may have romantic feelings for you. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Pay attention to how her friends treat you.
steps.content: Pay attention to how her friends treat you. If they show a sudden interest in you or ask you a lot of personal questions, chances are they are trying to get to know you better because their friend has strong feelings for you. If they try to tease you when the girl is around, it is probably because she likes you.

steps.title: Listen for certain statements she makes around you.
steps.content: Listen for certain statements she makes around you. When a girl likes you, she will indirectly express it when you two hang out. Here are some things she may say: "I love spending time with you." "You're my favorite person." "You are so funny."

steps.title: Take note of who initiates conversation.
steps.content: Take note of who initiates conversation. If a girl always starts a conversation with you, especially if she has no real reason to talk to you in the first place, she’s definitely interested! If she sends you text messages just to say hi, or that she's thinking about you, it's a good sign.

steps.title: Be straightforward and ask how she feels.
steps.content: Be straightforward and ask how she feels. It is okay to ask someone about their feelings for you. [8] X Research source It may seem embarrassing at first, but if she cares about you, either as a friend or something more, she will get over it and appreciate that you feel comfortable enough to be open and honest . Here are some ways you can ask: "How do you feel about me?" "Do you see me as a friend, or do you see me becoming something more?"

steps.title: Ask questions about love and romance.
steps.content: Ask questions about love and romance. If you do not want to come straight out and ask how she feels about you, then ask questions about love that may help you figure things out. Here are some questions you can ask: "How do you feel about falling in love?" "Do you think people can fall in love after being good friends?"

steps.title: Ask a mutual friend how she feels.
steps.content: Ask a mutual friend how she feels. Girls tell their friends almost everything. If you are too nervous to directly ask a girl if she has feelings for you, casually ask a friend she is close to. Be aware that once you start inquiring to friends, they will likely report what you said back to this girl. Here are casual questions you can ask: "Do you know if she like anyone?" "Does she ever talk about dating?" Reader Poll: We asked 1600 wikiHow readers who they go to when they need advice, and 61% said that they reach out to their best friend. [Take Poll] Not only will this girl's best friend probably know how she feels, but confiding in one of your friends may also help you understand your feelings.

steps.title: Find out how she talks about you when you are not around.
steps.content: Find out how she talks about you when you are not around. If a girl finds a reason to constantly bring up your name, speaks positively of you when you are not around, or smiles when your name is mentioned, she has strong feelings for you.

steps.title: Initiate a date.
steps.content: Initiate a date. Build up some courage and ask this girl to see a movie with you, or grab dinner. If she dresses up, or puts on more makeup than usual, then she is trying to impress you. A girl who loves you will want to stand out in your eyes by looking great and being fun.
